step1.sentence: A great mentor knows how to instill confidence in their students by celebrating small wins along the way.

step2.story: Before the big presentation, Sarah's manager pulled her aside and told her she was the best person for this pitch. Those few words were enough to instill confidence in her, and she walked into the boardroom ready to deliver. Her proposal won the client over.

step3.story: Daniel had struggled with stage fright for years, convinced he would never be able to speak in front of a crowd. His drama teacher, Ms. Rivera, refused to give up on him. Week after week, she gave him small roles and praised every improvement, working steadily to instill confidence in him one step at a time. By the end of the semester, Daniel stood at the center of the stage for the school play and delivered every line without hesitation. The applause that followed was the loudest he had ever heard. He realized that confidence wasn't something you were born with — it was something someone believed into you first.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 'instill'은 '서서히 스며들게 하다', 'confidence'는 '자신감'으로, 직역하면 '자신감을 서서히 심어넣다'는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 누군가의 내면에 자신감이 자리잡도록 꾸준히 격려하거나 환경을 만들어줄 때 사용한다. 부모, 교사, 리더 등이 타인에게 긍정적 영향을 줄 때 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'instill'은 라틴어 'instillare(방울방울 떨어뜨리다)'에서 유래했으며, 액체를 한 방울씩 스며들게 하듯 가치나 감정을 서서히 심어준다는 뉘앙스를 담고 있다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 칭찬하는 것보다 더 지속적이고 의도적인 행위를 암시한다. 자신감이 외부로부터 내면에 천천히 뿌리내리도록 돕는다는 능동적인 역할이 강조된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Coaches who instill confidence in young athletes help them perform beyond their own expectations.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 어린 선수들에게 자신감을 심어주는 코치는 그들이 스스로의 기대를 뛰어넘어 활약하도록 돕는다.
